definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)

sentences.english: I winked at Keith who laughed.
sentences.chinese: 我向基斯拋媚眼，他笑了。

sentences.english: Jack has been ey(e)ing her up all morning.
sentences.chinese: 傑克整個上午一直對她做媚眼。

sentences.english: Tom ogles on a pretty boy.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆給一個靚仔拋媚眼。

sentences.english: She ogled me when handed me a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她在把酒杯遞到我手上時對我做了個媚眼。

sentences.english: Did you just make eyes at him?
sentences.chinese: 妳剛剛在對他拋媚眼嗎？

sentences.english: Better the flat leer of the idiot.
He ogled a lady in the pub。
sentences.chinese: 他在酒吧裏向一位女士拋媚眼。

sentences.english: They were looking at me, and leering.
sentences.chinese: 他們全都看着我，給我拋媚眼。

sentences.english: See , he is giving me the eye.
I think that girl winked at me.
sentences.chinese: 我想那個女孩在朝我拋媚眼。

sentences.english: You are makin' googoo eyes on my girl?
sentences.chinese: 喔喔喔哥們你敢對我的女人拋媚眼？

definition: to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)
autumn ripples/(fig.) luminous eyes of a woman/amorous glance
see 色瞇瞇|色眯眯[se4 mi1 mi1]
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
